Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Remimazolam vs. Propofol Anesthesia in Minor Hepatectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: 72 patients scheduled for elective minor hepatectomy were randomized 1:1

Participants.evidence: Conducted at Fudan University Shanghai Cancer Center, 72 patients scheduled for elective minor hepatectomy

Intervention.evidence: randomized 1:1 to receive either remimazolam (Group R) or propofol (Group P) anesthesia

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial evaluated the hemodynamic stability of remimazolam-based anesthesia compared to propofol-based anesthesia

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the hemodynamic instability score (HI-score)

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was performed using MinimPy2 software, with allocation concealment ensured

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors and data entry personnel

Number_Randomised.evidence: 72 patients scheduled for elective minor hepatectomy were randomized 1:1

Number_Analysed.evidence: 66 patients were analyzed (33 per group) using a per-protocol approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: Group R exhibited significantly lower total HI-scores (22.8 ± 2.1) compared to Group P (33.0 ± 4.1, p = 0.029)

Harms.evidence: No significant differences in major cardiovascular events or hospital stay were observed
